data.title: Ubisoft’s Classic Game “Beyond Good & Evil” Gets Enhanced Edition
data.meta_description: Ubisoft, a leading name in the gaming industry, is bringing back a classic title to the forefront with an enhanced edition of “Beyond Good & Evil.” This move
data.text:
Ubisoft, a leading name in the gaming industry, is bringing back a classic title to the forefront with an enhanced edition of “Beyond Good & Evil.” This move follows a recent Entertainment Software Rating Board (ESRB) rating and the appearance of Xbox achievements for the game.

Enhanced features for an epic adventure

The now-deleted store listing for “Beyond Good & Evil” revealed exciting enhancements for players. The game promises an epic adventure with improvements that include:

Enhanced Graphics: Players can experience the game in up to 4K resolution and 60 frames per second, ensuring a visually stunning journey.

Improved Controls: The controls have been refined for a smoother and more responsive gaming experience.

Enhanced Audio: Enjoy improved audio quality that immerses players even deeper into the game’s world.

Autosave and Cross-Save Features: The addition of autosave and cross-save functionality provides convenience and flexibility to players.

New Treasure Hunt: Explore the planet and uncover more about the protagonist Jade’s past through an exciting treasure hunt across Hillys, offering exclusive rewards.

Speedrun Mode: Test your skills with the new speedrun mode, challenging players to complete the game as quickly as possible.

Updated Achievements: Achievements have been refreshed, providing new challenges for both newcomers and long-time fans.

Anniversary Gallery: Dive into the game’s development and uncover its secrets through the anniversary gallery.

A classic revisited

“Beyond Good & Evil” is an action-adventure game that originally launched in 2003 on platforms including PlayStation 2, Xbox, GameCube, and PC. It later saw a re-release on PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 in 2011, allowing a new generation of players to experience its captivating storyline and gameplay.

Ubisoft has been teasing a sequel to the game for nearly two decades. The first teaser for “Beyond Good & Evil 2” was unveiled in 2008, but the project faced prolonged periods of silence. It resurfaced at E3 2017 and 2018 as a prequel, revealing a fresh direction for the beloved franchise.

In August 2020, exciting news emerged that a feature film adaptation of “Beyond Good & Evil” was in development at Netflix, further expanding the game’s universe and its reach to new audiences.

Challenges in development

The journey to create “Beyond Good & Evil 2” has not been without its challenges. In February, reports emerged that Ubisoft Montpellier’s managing director, Guillaume Carmona, had departed amid a labor investigation by local government authorities. Developers at the studio had faced issues, with many taking extended leave due to stress or illness as the development of “Beyond Good & Evil 2” continued.

The report suggested that the game had not even entered technical pre-production, as the studio struggled to settle on a creative vision for the project.

Tragically, in July, “Beyond Good & Evil 2” creative director Emile Morel passed away at the age of 40. Morel, who had worked on Ubisoft’s “Rayman Legends” for 14 years, left a lasting impact on the gaming industry. His contributions to “Beyond Good & Evil 2” will undoubtedly be remembered as a part of his impressive legacy.

As Ubisoft continues its efforts to bring the sequel to life, the enhanced edition of the original “Beyond Good & Evil” offers fans a chance to relive the magic of the classic while eagerly awaiting what the future holds for the franchise.
